tests.test:
mv: file (absolute path) to file (absolute path)
-fs NAMENODE -touchz /file1 -fs NAMENODE -mv /file1 /file2 -fs NAMENODE -ls /file*
-fs NAMENODE -rm /file2 :
TokenComparator Found 1 items
RegexpComparator ^-rw-r--r--( )*1( )*[a-z]*( )*supergroup( )*0( )*[0-9]{4,}-[0-9]{2,}-[0-9]{2,} [0-9]{2,}:[0-9]{2,}( )*/file2
RegexpComparator ^-rw-r--r--( )*1( )*[a-z]*( )*supergroup( )*0( )*[0-9]{4,}-[0-9]{2,}-[0-9]{2,} [0-9]{2,}:[0-9]{2,}( )*/file[^1]

test.description: mv: file (absolute path) to file (relative path)

comparator.expected-output: ^mv: Failed to rename hdfs://\w+[.a-z]*:[0-9]*/file1 to file2

test.description: mv: file (absolute path) to directory (absolute path); keep the same name at the destination
mv: file (absolute path) to directory (absolute path); keep the same name at the destination [ TIED to previous test ]

comparator.expected-output: ls: Cannot access /file1: No such file or directory.

test.description: mv: file (absolute path) to directory (absolute path); change the name at the destination
mv: file (absolute path) to directory (absolute path); change the name at the destination [ TIED to previous test ]

comparator.expected-output: ls: Cannot access /file1: No such file or directory.

test.description: mv: files (absolute path) to directory (absolute path) using globbing
mv: files (absolute path) to directory (absolute path) using globbing [ TIED to previous test ]

comparator.expected-output: ls: Cannot access /file*: No such file or directory.

test.description: mv: file (relative) to file (relative)

tests.test:
mv: moving file to file(rename in for hdfs:// path)
-fs NAMENODE -touchz hdfs:///file1 -fs NAMENODE -mv hdfs:///file1 hdfs:///file2 -fs NAMENODE -ls hdfs:///file*
-fs NAMENODE -rm hdfs:///file2 :
TokenComparator Found 1 items
RegexpComparator ^-rw-r--r--( )*1( )*[a-z]*( )*supergroup( )*0( )*[0-9]{4,}-[0-9]{2,}-[0-9]{2,} [0-9]{2,}:[0-9]{2,}( )*/file2
RegexpComparator ^-rw-r--r--( )*1( )*[a-z]*( )*supergroup( )*0( )*[0-9]{4,}-[0-9]{2,}-[0-9]{2,} [0-9]{2,}:[0-9]{2,}( )*/file[^1]

mv: moving files to directory in hdfs:// path - [ TIED to previous test ]

comparator.expected-output: ls: Cannot access hdfs:///file*: No such file or directory.

test.description: mv: moving file that does not exist in hdfs:// path

comparator.expected-output: mv: hdfs:/file1: No such file or directory

mv: moving file to directory (different name at the destination) in hdfs:// path [ TIED to previous test ]

-fs NAMENODE -rm NAMENODE/file2 :
TokenComparator Found 1 items
RegexpComparator ^-rw-r--r--( )*1( )*[a-z]*( )*supergroup( )*0( )*[0-9]{4,}-[0-9]{2,}-[0-9]{2,} [0-9]{2,}:[0-9]{2,}( )*/file2

mv: moving files to directory in Namenode's path - [ TIED to previous test ]

comparator.expected-output: ^ls: Cannot access hdfs:\/\/\w+[.a-z]*:[0-9]+\/file1: No such file or directory.

comparator.expected-output: ^mv: hdfs://\w+[.a-z]*:[0-9]+/file1: No such file or directory

tests.test:
cp: file (absolute path) to file (absolute path)
-fs NAMENODE -touchz /file1 -fs NAMENODE -cp /file1 /file2 -fs NAMENODE -ls /file*
-fs NAMENODE -rm /file* :
RegexpComparator ^-rw-r--r--( )*1( )*[a-z]*( )*supergroup( )*0( )*[0-9]{4,}-[0-9]{2,}-[0-9]{2,} [0-9]{2,}:[0-9]{2,}( )*/file1
RegexpComparator ^-rw-r--r--( )*1( )*[a-z]*( )*supergroup( )*0( )*[0-9]{4,}-[0-9]{2,}-[0-9]{2,} [0-9]{2,}:[0-9]{2,}( )*/file2

tests.test:
cp: copying non existent file (absolute path)
-fs NAMENODE -cp /file /file1
-fs NAMENODE -rmr /user :
RegexpComparator ^cp: File does not exist: /file

cp: copying non existent file (relative path)
-fs NAMENODE -cp file1 file2
-fs NAMENODE -rmr /user :
RegexpComparator ^cp: File does not exist: file1

test.description: cp: files to an existent file using globbing

comparator.expected-output: ^cp: When copying multiple files, destination should be a directory.

test.description: cp: files to an existent file without globbing

comparator.expected-output: ^cp: When copying multiple files, destination /file5 should be a directory.

test.description: cp: files to a non existent directory using globbing

comparator.expected-output: ^cp: When copying multiple files, destination should be a directory.

test.description: cp: files to a non existent directory without globbing

comparator.expected-output: ^cp: When copying multiple files, destination dir should be a directory.

tests.test:
cp: file to file copy in hdfs:// path
-fs NAMENODE -touchz hdfs:///file1 -fs NAMENODE -cp hdfs:///file1 hdfs:///file2 -fs NAMENODE -ls hdfs:///file*
-fs NAMENODE -rm hdfs:///file* :
RegexpComparator ^-rw-r--r--( )*1( )*[a-z]*( )*supergroup( )*0( )*[0-9]{4,}-[0-9]{2,}-[0-9]{2,} [0-9]{2,}:[0-9]{2,}( )*/file1
RegexpComparator ^-rw-r--r--( )*1( )*[a-z]*( )*supergroup( )*0( )*[0-9]{4,}-[0-9]{2,}-[0-9]{2,} [0-9]{2,}:[0-9]{2,}( )*/file2

cp: file to directory (different name at the destination) in hdfs:// path
cp: files to directory using globbing in hdfs:// path
cp: files to directory in hdfs:// path without globbing

cp: copying non existent file in hdfs:// path

:

test.description: help: help for ls

comparator.expected-output: ^-ls <path>:( |\t)*List the contents that match the specified file pattern. If( )*
^( |\t)*path is not specified, the contents of /user/<currentUser>( )*
^( |\t)*path is not specified, the contents of /user/<currentUser>( )*
^( |\t)*will be listed. Directory entries are of the form( )*
^( |\t)*and file entries are of the form( )*
^( |\t)*where n is the number of replicas specified for the file( )*
^( |\t)*and size is the size of the file, in bytes.( )*

test.description: help: help for lsr

comparator.expected-output: ^-lsr <path>:( |\t)*Recursively list the contents that match the specified( )*
^( |\t)*file pattern.( |\t)*Behaves very similarly to hadoop fs -ls,( )*
^( |\t)*except that the data is shown for all the entries in the( )*

test.description: help: help for get

comparator.expected-output: ^-get( )*\[-ignoreCrc\]( )*\[-crc\]( )*<src> <localdst>:( |\t)*Copy files that match the file pattern <src>( )*
^( |\t)*to the local name.( )*<src> is kept.( )*When copying mutiple,( )*
^( |\t)*files, the destination must be a directory.( )*

test.description: help: help for du

comparator.expected-output: ^-du \[-s\] \[-h\] <path>:\s+Show the amount of space, in bytes, used by the files that\s*
^\s*match the specified file pattern. The following flags are optional:
^\s*-s\s*Rather than showing the size of each individual file that
^\s*matches the pattern, shows the total \(summary\) size.
^\s*-h\s*Formats the sizes of files in a human-readable fashion
^\s*Note that, even without the -s option, this only shows size summaries

test.description: help: help for dus

comparator.expected-output: ^-dus <path>:( |\t)*Show the amount of space, in bytes, used by the files that( )*
^( |\t)*match the specified file pattern. This is equivalent to -du -s above.

test.description: help: help for count

comparator.expected-output: ^-count\[-q\] <path>: Count the number of directories, files and bytes under the paths( )*
^( |\t)*that match the specified file pattern. The output columns are:( )*

test.description: help: help for mv

comparator.expected-output: ^-mv <src> <dst>:( |\t)*Move files that match the specified file pattern <src>( )*
^( |\t)*to a destination <dst>. When moving multiple files, the( )*

test.description: help: help for cp

comparator.expected-output: ^-cp <src> <dst>:( |\t)*Copy files that match the file pattern <src> to a( )*
^( |\t)*destination. When copying multiple files, the destination( )*

test.description: help: help for rm

comparator.expected-output: ^-rm \[-skipTrash\] <src>:( |\t)*Delete all files that match the specified file pattern.( )*

comparator.expected-output: ^-moveFromLocal <localsrc> ... <dst>: Same as -put, except that the source is( )*

^( |\t)*to the local name.( )*<src> is kept.( )*When copying mutiple,( )*
^( |\t)*files, the destination must be a directory.( )*

test.description: help: help for getmerge

comparator.expected-output: ^-getmerge <src> <localdst>: Get all the files in the directories that( )*
^( |\t)*match the source file pattern and merge and sort them to only( )*
^( |\t)*one file on local fs. <src> is kept.( )*

test.description: help: help for cat

comparator.expected-output: ^-cat <src>:( |\t)*Fetch all files that match the file pattern <src>( )*

comparator.expected-output: ^-touchz <path>: Write a timestamp in yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss format( )*

comparator.expected-output: ^-test -\[ezd\] <path>: If file \{ exists, has zero length, is a directory( )*

comparator.expected-output: ^-stat \[format\] <path>: Print statistics about the file/directory at <path>( )*
^( |\t)*in the specified format. Format accepts filesize in blocks \(%b\), filename \(%n\),( )*

test.description: help: help for tail

comparator.expected-output: ^-tail \[-f\] <file>: Show the last 1KB of the file.( )*
^( |\t)*The -f option shows apended data as the file grows.( )*

test.description: help: help for chmod

comparator.expected-output: ^( |\t)*This works similar to shell's chmod with a few exceptions.( )*
^( |\t)*-R( |\t)*modifies the files recursively. This is the only option( )*
^( |\t)*MODE( |\t)*Mode is same as mode used for chmod shell command.( )*
^( |\t)*OCTALMODE Mode specifed in 3 or 4 digits. If 4 digits, the first may( )*
^( |\t)*be 1 or 0 to turn the sticky bit on or off, respectively.( )*Unlike( |\t)*shell command, it is not possible to specify only part of the mode( )*
^( |\t)*If none of 'augo' is specified, 'a' is assumed and unlike( )*

test.description: help: help for chown

comparator.expected-output: ^( |\t)*Changes owner and group of a file.( )*
^( |\t)*This is similar to shell's chown with a few exceptions.( )*
^( |\t)*-R( |\t)*modifies the files recursively. This is the only option( )*
^( |\t)*If only owner or group is specified then only owner or( )*
^( |\t)*The owner and group names may only cosists of digits, alphabet,( )*
^( |\t)*and any of '-_.@/' i.e. \[-_.@/a-zA-Z0-9\]. The names are case( )*
^( |\t)*WARNING: Avoid using '.' to separate user name and group though( )*
^( |\t)*Linux allows it. If user names have dots in them and you are( )*
^( |\t)*using local file system, you might see surprising results since( )*
^( |\t)*shell command 'chown' is used for local files.( )*

test.description: help: help for chgrp
help: help for help

comparator.expected-output: ^-help \[cmd\]:( |\t)*Displays help for given command or all commands if none( )*

test.description: help: help for dfsadmin report
help: help for dfsadmin safemode

comparator.expected-output: ^( |\t)*Safe mode is a Namenode state in which it( )*
^( |\t)*1.( )*does not accept changes to the name space \(read-only\)( )*
^( |\t)*Safe mode is entered automatically at Namenode startup, and( )*
^( |\t)*leaves safe mode automatically when the configured minimum( )*
^( |\t)*percentage of blocks satisfies the minimum replication( )*
^( |\t)*condition. Safe mode can also be entered manually, but then( )*
^( |\t)*it can only be turned off manually as well.( )*

test.description: help: help for dfsadmin refreshNodes

comparator.expected-output: ^-refreshNodes:( |\t)*Updates the set of hosts allowed to connect to namenode.( )*
^( |\t)*Re-reads the config file to update values defined by( )*
^( |\t)*Each entry not defined in dfs.hosts but in( )*
^( |\t)*in dfs.hosts and also in dfs.host.exclude is stopped from( )*
^( |\t)*decommissioning if it has aleady been marked for decommission.( )*
^( |\t)*Entires not present in both the lists are decommissioned.( )*

comparator.expected-output: ^( |\t)*a detailed status or force the upgrade to proceed.( )*

^( |\t)*<filename> will contain one line for each of the following( )*

test.description: help: help for dfsadmin setQuota

comparator.expected-output: ^-setQuota <quota> <dirname>...<dirname>: Set the quota <quota> for each directory <dirName>.( )*
^( |\t)*The directory quota is a long integer that puts a hard limit( )*
^( |\t)*on the number of names in the directory tree( )*
^( |\t)*For each directory, attempt to set the quota. An error will be reported if( )*
^( |\t)*1. N is not a positive integer, or( )*
^( |\t)*2. user is not an administrator, or( )*
^( |\t)*3. the directory does not exist or is a file, or( )*

test.description: help: help for dfsadmin clrQuota

comparator.expected-output: ^-clrQuota <dirname>...<dirname>: Clear the quota for each directory <dirName>.( )*
^( |\t)*For each directory, attempt to clear the quota. An error will be reported if( )*
^( |\t)*1. the directory does not exist or is a file, or( )*
^( |\t)*It does not fault if the directory has no quota.( )*

test.description: help: help for dfsadmin setSpaceQuota

comparator.expected-output: ^-setSpaceQuota <quota> <dirname>...<dirname>: Set the disk space quota <quota> for each directory <dirName>.( )*
^( |\t)*The space quota is a long integer that puts a hard limit( )*
^( |\t)*on the total size of all the files under the directory tree.( )*
^( |\t)*2. user is not an administrator, or( )*

test.description: help: help for dfsadmin clrSpaceQuota

comparator.expected-output: ^-clrSpaceQuota <dirname>...<dirname>: Clear the disk space quota for each directory <dirName>.( )*
^( |\t)*For each directory, attempt to clear the quota. An error will be reported if( )*
^( |\t)*1. the directory does not exist or is a file, or( )*
^( |\t)*It does not fault if the directory has no quota.( )*

comparator.expected-output: ^-help \[cmd\]:( |\t)*Displays help for the given command or all commands if none( )*

test.description: verifying error messages for quota commands - setting quota on a file

comparator.expected-output: Cannot set quota on a file: /test/file1

test.description: verifying error messages for quota commands - setting quota on non-existing file
verifying error messages for quota commands - exceeding quota

comparator.expected-output: The NameSpace quota (directories and files) of directory /test is exceeded

test.description: verifying error messages for quota commands - setting not valid quota
verifying error messages for quota commands - setting not valid space quota
verifying error messages for quota commands - clearQuota on non existing file
verifying error messages for quota commands - using globing

comparator.expected-output: put: The DiskSpace quota of /dir1 is exceeded: quota=1024 diskspace consumed=[0-9.]+[kmg]*

test.description: verifying error messages for quota commands - setting quota using globing

comparator.expected-output: mkdir: The NameSpace quota (directories and files) of directory /dir1 is exceeded: quota=1 file count=2

test.description: refreshServiceAcl: refreshing security authorization policy for namenode
safemode: Test for enter - Namenode is not in safemode
safemode: Test for enter - Namenode is already in safemode

safemode: Test for leave - Namenode is not in safemode
safemode: Test for get - Namenode is not in safemode
safemode:Test for get - Namenode is already in safemode
safemode: Test for wait - Namenode is not in safemode
safemode: Test for wait - Namenode is already in safemode

saveNamespace: to save the namespace when safemode is ON
saveNamespace: to save the namespace when safemode is OFF

metasave: to save metadata
